reviewText:
Jesus christ i played this game 19 years ago and i did not even know what i was playing was a DEMO?!?!??!

Episode 1 took me almost a day to finish it when i was a kid, and now i bought it on steam and i see it has actually 2 more episodes WOW!!!!!

What i always loved about this game was the soundtracks i really enjoyed them all for some reason :D

Back in 1990s there was a freeware" version of this game (Aka DEMO) and it was pretty long
date: you had full access to episode 1 which was long enough to make you believe you actually had played the complete game not a freeware. but these days games get released in funny prices $60 for less than DEMOs then $50 season passes which gives you a bit more access to the game time to time.\n\nGood old days that "gamers" used to be developers
recommended: today "businessmen" are the developers! just like this game says "R.I.P""

reviewText: It's a very fun MS-DOS Classic game to play since I was Child. World War 3 has broken out due to a Kretons Invasion from another galaxy using a Wormhole! Join forces with Major Harrison Stryker, hero of WWIII, to travel through the Kreton Wormhole, destroy the Kreton Homeworlds & put an end to World War 3 so you can return to Admiral Yoshira's loving arms.

reviewText: If you are a space shooter looking for a challenge,  look no further.  This game is well put together.  My only complaints deal with the confusing EGA color palette.  Sometimes the foreground and the background colors blend together and makes things confusing.
I like this game but I dont like that the ship is slow and that its one-hit death. Other than that, its a pretty good game.
